titles.title: Recognizing the outstanding efforts of the individuals and communities who volunteered or donated items to the North Platte Canteen in North Platte, Nebraska, during World War II from December 25, 1941, to April 1, 1946.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Total Force.
Mr. Franks (AZ) moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 161.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 9/27/2004--Passed Senate without amendment. Recognizes the outstanding efforts of the individuals and communities involved with the North Platte Canteen that served the needs of six million military personnel who traveled through North Platte, Nebraska, on troop trains from December 25, 1941, to April 1, 1946, during World War II.
